page.title: 12The population of Lullington
page.content: Lullington has an ageing population. Most inhabitants are aged over 35 years and there is a very high proportion of pensioners. This absence of the younger generation is largely due to the lack of employment opportunites in the area. Infact 53% of the working population was found to be directly related to agriculture in the 1981 census. Those that do not work on local farms commute to Burton-on-Trent, Swadlincote of Tamworth (in each case distances of approximately 10km). Another factor encouraging more mature villagers may be the absence of social facilities desired by younger age groups.
